intro: Brachystelma cathcartense, commonly known as the Cathcart's ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically during the winter months. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
